solution_line_template: If the TV's original price was ${tv_initial_price}, at the auction, its price increased by {tv_increase_fraction}*${tv_initial_price} = $<<{tv_increase_fraction}*{tv_initial_price}={tv_price_increase}>>{tv_price_increase}
The total price at which the TV was sold at the auction is ${tv_initial_price}+${tv_price_increase} = <<{tv_initial_price}+{tv_price_increase}={tv_final_price}>>{tv_final_price}

The price of the phone also increased at the action, a 40% increase which is {phone_increase_percentage}*${phone_initial_price} = $<<{phone_increase_percentage}*{phone_initial_price}={phone_price_increase}>>{phone_price_increase}

The total price that the phone was sold for after the auction is ${phone_initial_price}+${phone_price_increase} = <<{phone_initial_price}+{phone_price_increase}={phone_final_price}>>{phone_final_price}
In total, the TV and the phone sold for ${tv_final_price}+${phone_final_price} = <<{tv_final_price}+{phone_final_price}={total_received_amount}>>{total_received_amount} at the auction
